title: A First Principles Approach to Trust-Based Recommendation Systems
authors: Paras Stefanopoulos, Ahad N. Zehmakan, Sourin Chatterjee
abstract:
This paper explores recommender systems in social networks which leverage
information such as item rating, intra-item similarities, and trust graph. We
demonstrate that item-rating information is more influential than other
information types in a collaborative filtering approach. The trust graph-based
approaches were found to be more robust to network adversarial attacks due to
hard-to-manipulate trust structures. Intra-item information, although
sub-optimal in isolation, enhances the consistency of predictions and lower-end
performance when fused with other information forms. Additionally, the Weighted
Average framework is introduced, enabling the construction of recommendation
systems around any user-to-user similarity metric.
